p: As reported in the primary clinical trial results ( Venkatraman et al., 2018), vaccine-specific antibody responses were significantly lower in the Senegalese cohort than in the UK cohort at peak and late time points ( Fig. 1 B). However, when stratified by CMV serostatus, vaccine-specific antibody responses were significantly lower in CMV + than CMV − UK participants ( Fig. 1, C and D; P = 0.028). Senegalese participants, who were all CMV +, had vaccine-specific antibody responses that were comparable to those of UK CMV + participants (P = 0.52) but significantly lower than those of CMV − participants (P = 0.0032).
